children.subject: I believe that the school is currently mandating that all sections next semester will be in-person, and consequently interns would need to attend in-person.
Are you required to be in-person for labs or is there a remote option?

Interns will sometimes help students with projects if lab is a project work day that week, but we will clearly outline the expectations for the extent of what you should know for the projects beforehand. Lab walkthroughs are essentially the lab solution, with the thought process attached
Do interns help debug the projects? Also, lab walkthrough video = lab solution?
Can we choose to decline our acceptance offer even if we get accepted?
<md>We have not looked at applications yet, and will only begin processing after they have closed.</md>

I filled out my application for the AI position for 61B some time ago but I updated my responses to better reflect my thoughts. Have the applications already been looked over? If so, I'm wondering if it's possible to have course staff reconsider my updated application. I appreciate the consideration.

Thanks.

history.content:
Hi y'all! Just wanted to let you know that the Spring 2022 CS 61B AI app has been released! Being an intern is a super fun and rewarding experience - you'll facilitate labs by helping students with their assignments and conceptual understanding of the class, and you get lots of hands-on teaching experience along the way. Some quick preliminaries:

All interns will be expected to...
- Attend a pre-semester talk about the program / instructing students.
- Have one half hour mid-semester meeting with your TA and their other interns.
- Regularly submit assignments to the autograder (these are the same assignments students will be completing; the lab will be made available to you in advance and will be accompanied by a walkthrough video).

- Fill out the mid-semester survey.

- Attend 80% of your required labs. There may be some make up opportunities available. Each lab will be two hours long.

Being an AI is designed to take roughly 3 hours of your time per week, which corresponds to 1 unit of PNP credit for Spring 2022. Completing all of the above bullet points will get you a P. Do note that you cannot become an intern without taking the class for a unit.

The application is available here. It is due Sunday, January 9, 2022 at 11:59 pm PT. Expect decisions before the semester starts.

Here are some common questions about applying to be an AI:

Do I need to have gotten an A in 61B to apply?
Nope, the application process is grade blind! You are selected based off your answers to the application questions. 


What times are available for labs?
This will not be decided until closer towards the semester, but labs are normally W-F. You can take a look at last semester's website to get an idea what the schedule might look like.

Please comment here with any further questions or email me at crystalwang@berkeley.edu if you have any more personal questions!
